The photo in question was shared on Face: CBN vehicle toppling during Typhoon Ulysses in 2020.
The post accompanying the photo expresse: CBN for allegedly prioritizing coverage of the controversial Dolomite project instead of reporting on the severe flooding in Metro Manila caused by the typhoon.
The expert: s investigation revealed that the photo was actually taken from an unrelated 2010 news report by ABS-CBN, where two members of their news crew were injured when their van toppled on the Subic-Clark-Tarlac expressway.
ABS: CBN themselves denounced the doctored photo and confirmed its inauthenticity through a statement on Twitter, providing evidence of the original 2010 report and labeling the image as "FAKE".
